title: Strictly's Shirley Ballas puts on a brave face at It Takes Two after being hooked to a drip
text:

Strictly Come Dancing 's head judge Shirley Ballas returned to work at the It Takes Two studios in London on Friday afternoon after being hooked on a drip.

The dancing legend, 59, appeared make-up free and in good spirits as she arrived at the London venue wearing a faux fur coat and black suede boots.

Shirley looked glowing as she beamed with a smile after recently worrying fans as she was struck by illness and shared snaps of herself hooked up to a vitamin drip.

The Strictly Come Dancing judge appeared on Friday's episode of It Takes Two alongside co-hosts Rylan and Zoe Ball .

She shared her excitement ahead of the show with her Instagram followers.

She wrote:"Looking forward to my first It takes 2 this evening. Always a treat with Rylan and Zoe Ball all time in I’m sure it will be a fun show."

(Image: JAMES CURLEY)

Worried fans instantly commented on Shirley's health and wished her well.

One wrote: "You're a storm trooper. Stay well!"

While another posted: "Hope you're feeling better."

A third fan appeared worried as they replied: "I'll be watching It Takes Two tonight. You sound a bit croaky. I hope you feel better soon."

Taking to Instagram earlier, Shirley posted several snaps that showed a vitamin drip attached to her arm, and admitted to her followers it had been a 'tough week.'

She wrote: "Full of all sorts of things Vitamin c, Magnesium b12 and the list goes on. Feeling under the weather today as a result of a tough week.

"Hopefully we'll be right as rain for Saturday" she posted.

It comes after pro dancer Dianne Buswell begged fans to stop sending Shirley death threats, following her and radio DJ Dev Griffin's controversial exit from the popular BBC dance competition last weekend.

The 59-year-old head judge was targeted by furious viewers after the DJ was booted off the competition.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Dev's former dance partner Dianne was forced to take to Twitter and plead with trolls to stop sending Shirley Ballas death threats.

Strictly is already one judge down this week with Bruno Tonilio skipping the fifth show of the series to focus on his Dancing With The Stars commitments.

Bruno will be replaced on Saturday by Fresh Prince of Bel Air star Alfonso Ribeiro.

Strictly Come Dancing 2019 continues Saturday with the results show on Sunday on BBC One.
description: Strictly Come Dancing's head judge Shirley Ballas appeared healthy as she arrived at Strictly spin-off show after being struck by illness
